GoalDescription: An enabling business environment, creating opportunities and employment for entrepreneurs throughout Vanuatu
PolicyObjectiveDescription: Increase labour mobility nationally and internationally, including through the collection and analysis of comprehensive labour market data
IndicatorDescription: Total annual remittances as a proportion of GDP
Concept:
* Remittances usually flows to developing countries
* Money sent home through remittances competes with international aid as one of the largest financial inflows to developing countries. Workers’ remittances are a significant part of international capital flow, especially with regard to labour-exporting countries.
DataSource: * Reserve Bank of Vanuatu Quarterly Report
Definition:
* Remittances is the financial or in-kind transfers made by migrants to friends and relatives back in communities of origin. 
* It is a transfer of money, often by a foreign worker to an individual in their home country.
Rationale:
* Workers’ remittances have become a major source of external development finance especially to the communities which assist government financial development to rural settings specially to alleviate the problem of poverty on individual basis.
* This will also enable the community on how best to manage and strengthen their remittances.
